name: The Fool
description: A young figure stands at the cliff's edge with a small bag and a dog at their side, gazing forward, symbolizing adventure, spontaneity, and trust in the unknown.

name: The Fool Reversed
description: The figure teeters near the cliff's edge, distracted or heedless, indicating poor judgment, impulsivity, and risk without awareness.

name: The Magician
description: A figure stands before a table of tools representing the four suits, one hand pointing to heaven and the other to earth, symbolizing the power to manifest ideas into reality.

name: The Magician Reversed
description: The tools lie unused or scattered, the figure appears distracted, symbolizing misused talents, deception, or failure to act effectively.

name: The High Priestess
description: A serene woman sits between black and white pillars, holding a scroll, with a crescent moon at her feet, representing inner knowledge, intuition, and hidden truths.

name: The High Priestess Reversed
description: The pillars tilt or the scroll is hidden, symbolizing blocked intuition, secrets misused, or misunderstanding of inner guidance.

name: The Empress
description: A regal woman sits surrounded by nature and wheat fields, wearing a crown, symbolizing growth, abundance, and maternal care.

name: The Empress Reversed
description: The lush surroundings are wilting or distant, indicating blocked creativity, over-dependence, or imbalance in nurturing.

name: The Emperor
description: A seated figure wears armor and a crown, holding a scepter, with a solid throne, symbolizing order, structure, and leadership.

name: The Emperor Reversed
description: The throne appears unstable or the figure harsh, indicating misuse of authority, rigidity, or oppressive control.

name: The Hierophant
description: A spiritual figure sits between pillars, handing wisdom to followers, representing tradition, teaching, and moral guidance.

name: The Hierophant Reversed
description: The figure's authority is questioned or ignored, symbolizing rejection of tradition, false teachings, or lack of spiritual direction.

name: The Lovers
description: Two figures stand together under an angel, with a tree behind each, symbolizing relationships, alignment, and meaningful choices.

name: The Lovers Reversed
description: The angel looks distant, and figures appear divided, symbolizing broken connections, misaligned values, or difficult choices.

name: The Chariot
description: A warrior rides a chariot pulled by two sphinxes, representing triumph through focus, control, and determination.

name: The Chariot Reversed
description: The sphinxes pull in opposing directions or the chariot is unsteady, symbolizing lack of control, obstacles, or scattered willpower.

name: Strength
description: A figure gently tames a lion, symbolizing courage, soft control, compassion, and mastery over base instincts.

name: Strength Reversed
description: The lion appears aggressive or the figure unsure, symbolizing lack of inner control, insecurity, or giving in to impulses.

name: The Hermit
description: A cloaked figure holds a lantern atop a mountain, symbolizing inner reflection, seeking truth, and solitary wisdom.

name: The Hermit Reversed
description: The lantern is dim or the figure lost, symbolizing fear of solitude, unwillingness to reflect, or isolation.

name: Wheel of Fortune
description: A wheel turns with symbols of the four elements and sphinxes, representing cycles, destiny, and inevitable change.

name: Wheel of Fortune Reversed
description: The wheel tilts or spins erratically, symbolizing blocked progress, unexpected misfortune, or resistance to change.

name: Justice
description: A figure holds scales and a sword, seated between pillars, symbolizing impartiality, truth, and law.

name: Justice Reversed
description: The scales tip or the sword wavers, symbolizing injustice, corruption, or imbalance.

name: The Hanged Man
description: A figure hangs upside-down from a tree, calm and serene, symbolizing suspension, new perspective, and surrender.

name: The Hanged Man Reversed
description: The figure struggles or seems impatient, symbolizing resistance to letting go or failure to gain insight.

name: Death
description: A skeletal figure rides a white horse, carrying a black flag, symbolizing endings that lead to transformation and renewal.

name: Death Reversed
description: The figure is blocked or denied, symbolizing reluctance to embrace endings or transformation.

name: Temperance
description: An angel blends water between two cups, standing with one foot on land and one in water, symbolizing balance and integration.

name: Temperance Reversed
description: The angel spills water or misbalances the cups, symbolizing disharmony, extremes, or impatience.

name: The Devil
description: A horned figure stands over chained humans, representing temptation, material attachment, and restriction.

name: The Devil Reversed
description: Chains are broken or loosened, symbolizing liberation from attachments or destructive patterns.

name: The Tower
description: A tall tower is struck by lightning, people falling from it, symbolizing sudden disruption, awakening, or dramatic change.

name: The Tower Reversed
description: The tower is shaking but still standing, symbolizing avoidance of inevitable upheaval or delayed realization.

name: The Star
description: A woman kneels by water, pouring water into a pool and onto the land, with stars above, symbolizing hope, guidance, and renewal.

name: The Star Reversed
description: The stars are dim or obscured, water spills wastefully, symbolizing lost hope or guidance.

name: The Moon
description: A moon shines between two towers, a wolf and dog howl, and a crayfish emerges from water, symbolizing illusion, subconscious, and intuition.

name: The Moon Reversed
description: The moon’s light is unclear or flickering, the path uncertain, symbolizing disorientation, hidden dangers, or deception.

name: The Sun
description: A child rides a white horse beneath a bright sun, sunflowers behind, symbolizing happiness, clarity, and optimism.

name: The Sun Reversed
description: Sunlight dimmed or child uncertain, symbolizing temporary obstacles, diminished clarity, or delayed success.

name: Judgement
description: Angels blow trumpets as figures rise from graves, symbolizing awakening, self-evaluation, and transformative calling.

name: Judgement Reversed
description: Figures hesitate or do not rise, symbolizing avoidance of truth, procrastination, or ignoring guidance.

name: The World
description: A dancer or figure is surrounded by a laurel wreath, with four figures in corners, symbolizing completion, harmony, and success.

name: The World Reversed
description: The wreath is broken or figure appears unbalanced, symbolizing incomplete cycles, delays, or obstacles to fulfillment.
